title: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor.
description: When comparing the time it takes to revert a file with closing and reopening the file in the Java editor, it is observed that reverting the file is significantly slower.
OB: Upon selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: This behavior is unexpected, as reverting the file should not take longer than closing and reopening the file.
SR:
1) Open an editor on the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' from the source folder 'Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository.
2) Select the end of the first line and add a space character to mark the file as dirty.
3) Close the editor by clicking on the close box in the editor tab and choose 'no' when prompted to save changes.
4) Reopen the file by double-clicking on it in the navigator.

Repeat steps 1) and 2).
5) Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor to replace the contents of the window with the original.

Note: The observed time for closing and reopening the file is approximately 8 seconds, while the observed time for reverting the file is approximately 15 seconds.
